Line 5: Line 5:
Today, Siegel is a civil rights attorney at the Oakland-based law firm, [[Siegel & Yee]].<ref>[http://www.siegelyee.com Siegel & Yee<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> In the last few years, he has won a series of high-profile sexual harassment and employment discrimination lawsuits and has represented clients such as [[Pacifica Radio]] and the [[National Union of Healthcare Workers]]. In 2006 he completed an eight-year tenure on the [[Oakland Unified School District]] Board of Directors.
Today, Siegel is a civil rights attorney at the Oakland-based law firm, [[Siegel & Yee]].<ref>[http://www.siegelyee.com Siegel & Yee<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> In the last few years, he has won a series of high-profile sexual harassment and employment discrimination lawsuits and has represented clients such as [[Pacifica Radio]] and the [[National Union of Healthcare Workers]]. In 2006 he completed an eight-year tenure on the [[Oakland Unified School District]] Board of Directors.
  +   +
Siegel, a long-time friend of Oakland Mayor [[Jean Quan]], served as her legal adviser until November 14, 2011, when he resigned in protest. Seigel subsequently announced, via Twitter: "No longer Mayor Quan's legal advisor. Resigned at 2 am. Support Occupy Oakland, not the 1% and its government facilitators." <ref>[http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/blog/2011/nov/14/occupy-oakland-police-action-live?CMP=NECNETTXT8187 "Occupy Oakland: demonstrators prepare for police action"]</ref><ref>[http://twitter.com/DanMSiegel/statuses/136100377203453952 Siegel's post on Twitter]</ref>
  +
